This game is AMAZING! You are Booker DeWitt and your job is to get the girl to remove the debt. Right away when you enter the city of Columbia you are captured by the great city. As you venture further you see the racist and diversed side of columbia and you notica a corrupt man by the name of comstock. When you get Elizabeth she is no princess but someone with smarts that will help you through the game. She picks lock finds and gives u health ammo and salts during battle so you can like longer. She also finds money you may have missed. The vigors give you the ability to do special things like real in your opponents or burn them. You can only hold 2 weapons at once besides the melee which sucks but really the only bad thing about this game. Also Elizabeth can open things called tears which she can open so you can have a wall, turret, platform just to name a few. The final thing is THE SKYLINE!
The skyline is soooooooooo much fun. You canuse to trasport place to place. shoot from above. Escape near death and most importantly do the sexiest attack ever! You insta-kill the oppenent and it looks sooo cool. Overall this game is a 10 out of 10 and 100% a must buy!
Best story ever for a first person shooter. The graphics are fantastic, the gameplay has tight mechanics, and the game is simply fun as hell.
I played 8.3 hours and got bored of this game.
Friggin awesome game!!!  Great graphics and play.  The best part is that Elizabeth is actually helpful and doesn't get in your way lol =)

What an excellent game,i will just start saying that this is the best game i have ever played since Half-Life 2,you start the game as Booker DeWitt with the objective to bring back the girl and wipe away the debt,you arrive in columbia an incredibly religious city founded by father comstock. The immersion in this game is Metro 2033´s immersion times two,you arrive in the city as a tourist and start learning about the city,and besides the unbelievable immersion,the combat in this game is really well done,the idea that you can combine two vigors (the plasmids in BioShock 1 however with a different name) to create all sorts of traps and creative kills makes the game really fun,and the story is just incredible it introduces you to a world where religion is taken seriously and you get introduced to elizabeth the most human NPC i have ever seen,there where moments that i almost cried when she told about her past and what she feels,its just like talking to a real women. this game is by no doubt a 10/10 i highly recommend you play this game,i call this game a "Rock in the era of Dubstep" because unfortunately today many games are modern military shooters and rarely we see a game like bioshock infinite showing that this is not the way games were meant to be.If you loved the first bioshock,half-life,system shock,metro 2033 and many other classic pc games this game is a must-have.
Simply one of the best games in this universe. Just play it.
This game is both stunning and a highly enjoyable story experience, I plee with you to get this game and play to fall in love with, and get the best story experience so far

Это одна из лучших видеоигр в которые я играл, если не лучшая. Вроде и много всего хочется написать, а слов-то и нет. Все на месте ("маяк, человек, город") - закрученный и захватывающий сюжет с потрясающей (мягко говоря) концовкой, ворохом отличных персонажей и отменным экшеном. Ну и, конечно, Элизабет. Мало того, что сценаристы прописали ей просто шикарный характер и историю, программисты - почти идеальный ИИ, а художники - внешность, так мистер Левин решил вписать ее в, собственно, игровой процесс. Шустрая девчушка тягает главному герою боеприпасы, когда они заканчиваются, аптечки - когда шкала здоровья почти на нуле. Через час знакомства с ней, я думаю, любой нормальный человек к ней привяжется не на шутку. Такого раньше не было, что ни говори. В этом году уже была игра с девушкой, которая должна была стать прямо-таки живой, и которую мы, как нам обещалось, "захотели бы защищать", да еще и в главные роли - Tomb Raider. Но там все усилия художников, нарисовавших реально беззащитную девушку, были убиты об сценарий. Здесь же - иное. Когда идет бой - девчонка не мешается под ногами и помогает патронами, а когда настает время тихого изучения мира Колумбии - ходит вокруг и с интересом изучает все что видит, лопает сахарную вату пачками, отдыхает на скамейке - даже сматывается на танцы один раз. Конечно, здесь немаловажный факт играет само окружение. Прибытие в Колумбию - наверное, один из самых сильных моментов в видеоиграх, да и, наверное, то, за что мы их любим. Работа художников впечатляет. Нереально красиво и ярко. Приведя игрока в мир, казалось бы, утопии, разработчики проводят его через все круги ада. И посреди этого ада, творящегося вокруг - с нами всегда эта невинная девушка. Гениально. Сам мир Колумбии можно долго обсуждать, но лучше посмотреть один раз (минимум). BioShock - на редкость умная игра, которая пытается что-то сказать игроку. Вся система Колумбии - она как злобная карикатура, в которой сплелось множество элементов. Достается всем - и религии, и политике. Что-то подобное я последний раз видел в Deus Ex HR, но не таком уровне. Саундтрек, как обычно в играх Левина, помогает окунуться в мир и эпоху игры. Почти все композиции хоть сейчас в плеер. Сюжетный нарратив идеально выверен. Браво, мистер Кен Левин.

This game is simply amazing. Many have attempted to get an 'emotional response' from gamers, this game is the first to accomplish it. This is the first game I have ever played where I actually find myself caring about the characters. The story is interesting, the twist will leave you thinking for a while and Elizabeth is the most emotive character I've ever seen.

You basically run around stealing things from people like money, potions, and even food. Every once a while a bad guy will pop out, but since your a detective and the main charecter you can't die. There's also a girl who wont shut up about going to paris! SHE EVEN KNOCKS YOU OUT WHEN YOU'RE LIKE "BITCH PLEASE WE AINT GOING TO PARIS" damn aint nobody got time for that....

I'll start by saying this game is not worth full price.  The gameplay is simplified from the previous Bioshock's via removal of ammunition types and using the same effects on multiple vigors (Or plasmids).  Upgrading guns and vigors seems like a chore as the only way to do so is through a single resource, and really limits the weapons you end up using to only a few.
The story itself is pretty good, and it gets you attached to your companion, but the ending really kills it for me due to loop holes and oddly rapid character developement. 
Good game, and a good buy if its on sale, but for full price not worth it.  Weak link in the 'Shock' series.

OK, first off to get this out of the way, I will say get the game at some point. It is good. I will definately recommend it but I will say, wait a bit. Let the price fall a bit and then go for it. 
Now the reason I said the last bit is, for me anyway, it did feel a bit short and a wee bit hollow at times. The amont of NPC's in the area felt a wasted excercise. You could'nt interact with them. It gives the game the hollow feeling I said earlier. Don't get me wrong, they do give the game a more active and feeling of life than the previous Bioshock games where you only really saw people you had to dispatch in some ingenious or bullet ridden way. That of course is still there but with the amount of "ordinary people" in the areas, I feel an opportunity was missed to give little conversations you could have with them or even trade with.
Characters were also excellent I feel. The interaction beteen Booker (you) and Elizabeth was enjoyable and she herself is a great help within the game.
My other point is the length of the game. I have completed it and I did feel that the game ended quite quick. I did play it on Normal mode so I am going to play it again on a more difficult setting. 
I felt the combat very easy but fun to use. Combining the weapons with vigors, vigors with vigors and also throwing in the combat fun to be had on the skyrail kept me trying to invent new ways to dispatch my foes. Thinking back, most of the time that I was killed was through me concentrating too much on creating different ways to deal with the enemies.
Graphically the game is beautiful. Due to my specs I played the game with medium settings and it still looked incredible. Audio is just as impressive.
Overall, I would recommend the game but I will say it may leave you wanting more. DLC incoming I feel.
ИГРУХА КЛАСС !!!!

This game is an piece of history.  Video gaming at its apex.  The story is enthralling and the characters are all their own person.  They each have emotions that are carefully detailed into the game, and executed at perfect times with the games events.  No where in this game does a mechanic feel out of place, or even unnecessary.  The 1999 Difficulty isn't absurdly hard or unbeatable.  It forces the player to use the environment that the developers created to their advantage.  It takes away the ability to dive headfirst into a group of enemies and expect to win.  Play this game, enjoy it, love the twists and turns the story takes you on.  When the game ends, play it again.  There are so many Easter Eggs and little things to catch during the second playthrough that makes it worthwhile.  This game is easily an 11/10.

Ohoho...well, first of all Bioshock Infinite is not like the other 2 Bioshocks at all, it is a totally different world, story and such, but it keeps the old ''plasmid'' mechanic, with cool powers and combinations, also with enviromental hazards. The guns mechanic is also nice and realistic, you can only carry 2 of them and you need to take care of your ammunition at all times, if it ends, you need to get another gun from an enemy and so on, even so, overall, the game is very short and kinda easy, specially if compared to the last 2 who were SO DAMN HARD. but it still plays nice, not to mention the graphics are wonderful. Now heading to the story...JESUS MAN THIS GAME IS JUST SO GENIUS, HOLY SH*T, no, seriouly, the story of this game is simply GREAT, mind twisting at times, but that's part of the fun. You will probrably have some hard time to understand at first, but when you do...man, you won't regret it, it's an unique experience, it is a must to every gamer who appreciate genial storylines, you got to see it for yourself to understand how it feels, and I also don't wanna spoil anything. So both for the gameplay (even not being as challenging as the last ones) and the AMAZING story, that as many people say, is an unforgetable experience, I recommend it FOR SURE!!! :D
I don't want to spoil it, but... the ending made me cry, then during the credits I dried up, then the bit after the credits made me cry all over again. I will absolutely be playing this again.

Crazy good game!  Amazingly highly recommended! Going through the game, you learn a lot, you make assumptions, you are taught of certain things, then as the end comes, you start to see the holes, the lies, the misunderstandings of the assumptions from before ... then the end happens.... everything you thought you knew.... WAS WRONG!~

Its a great game, nonetheless though!  One word of advice while going through, listen to all the voxophones.  While you still get most of the story without listening to them, as you progress, they actually are REALLY helpful in giving more of the story as you go through... you learn more and see that your assumptions and everything you learn isn't entirely as it appears.

In Bioshock Infinite, there is less of a sense of total chaos and more one of order teetering on the brink of chaos. The consequence is that the game takes time to find its feet and is over too quickly. It doesn't have the same frightening atmosphere as the earlier Bioshock games until some of the latter stages, which is a bit disappointing, although Columbia is a breathtaking spectacle and the politics of the city are really important to the story.

The inclusion of salts as a proxy for plasmids is welcome, but their role in the city of Columbia isn't as crucial to the story as plasmids were to Rapture. They aren't completely plausible, even within the scope of a fantastical alternative reality, because the citizens of Columbia don't really use them. I think salts would tip the balance in favour of disorder if they were commonly used by the citizens of Columbia, and yet when order breaks down, it's not due to salts. 

Although some of the enemies in Bioshock Infinite are tough to kill, the greatest sense of peril is associated with losing some money upon 'death', so going into combat with empty pockets is paramount, but it somewhat kills the tension.

Bioshock Infinite did feel a bit too much like an animated story, rather than a game at times. I was so dumbfounded by the ending, that I wanted to replay it, in case I misheard something. I thought I knew what the writers were trying to say, but in the end, I wasn't even sure they knew. 

I enjoyed the game a great deal, but I think it could have been longer. The release of downloadable levels simultaneous with the game itself is just profiteering in my opinion. I might add that the lack of multiplayer is unforgiveable, and one of the reasons I'm feeling slightly bitter about the game.

告片小E有其他法術互動的很好! 但正式版沒有0.0"??

BioShock Infinite combines the good story of the first BioShock with the gameplay improvements of BioShock 2. Much of the combat itself lacks any real inspiration or innovation over the previous games, mostly serving as filler as you advance through the story. A great game nonetheless, and worth a second playthrough to make sense of everything that seemed innocuous or irrelevant on the first time through. Beyond that, it lacks any real replayability.

+ amazing story
+ beautiful and unique art style
+ a city in the sky
+ best AI companion ever in video game history
+ deep and touching
A bit on the short side, and checkpoint based saving is still the bane of PC gaming but overall a very enjoyable game. And an ending like I've never seen before.
神作就不用做過多的解釋了，女主角很萌是遊戲的亮點之一，同時遊戲的內涵也很深厚，講述了交錯在平行時空與現實世界的故事，涉及非常多的人性與倫理，對於工業革命時期的刻畫非常到位，整個劇情遊離在現實與平行世界之間，給人留下了無限的遐想空間，正好也呼應了遊戲的標題，期待以後的季票能對劇情給予更大的補充，讓整個遊戲的世界觀和故事更為豐滿。
